alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oneida; Power (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 12:24PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following counties, Bannock, Franklin, Oneida and Power. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1224 PM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sheep Creek, Hawkins Creek, Rowley Creek, Birch Creek, Mill Creek, South Fork Hawkins Creek, Marsh Creek, Rattlesnake Creek, Henderson Creek, Cherry Creek, Elkhorn Creek, Bannock Creek, Devil Creek, Potter Creek, Weston Creek, Little Malad River, Wright Creek, Precipice Creek, Hill Creek, Malad River, Deep Creek, Campbell Creek, Samaria Creek, Dry Creek, Station Creek, Third Creek and Yellow Dog Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malad, Pleasantview, Cherry Creek Rest Area, Samaria, Malad Pass and Daniels Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
